grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 屯【トン】ton (now usu. a metric ton, i.e. 1,000kg), tonne
屯営【トンエイ】military camp, barracks, camping
英噸【エイトン】long ton, British ton
kun reading compounds: 屯【たむろ】gathering, place where people gather, police station, camp, barracks
屯う【たむろう】to gather in large numbers (of people), to hang out (as a large group), to assemble (as a military unit or posse), to be quartered (in a particular location)
